alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 11:21PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Martin, northern Letcher, east central Perry, central Knott, eastern Floyd and Pike Counties through 1215 AM EST... At 1121 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Spider, or near Hindman, moving east at 80 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wheelwright, Fleming-Neon, Pippa Passes, May, Farraday, Lucastown, Tillie, Neon Junction, Pine Top and Buckingham around 1125 PM EST. Potters Fork, Beaver, Virgie, Whitaker, Buckhorn Hollow, Beefhide, Ligon, Jonancy, Dorton and Haymond around 1130 PM EST. Pikeville, Rockhouse, Lookout, Marrowbone, Ashcamp, Shelbiana, Shelby Gap and Adamson around 1135 PM EST. Elkhorn City, Garden Village, Fishtrap Lake, Chloe, Cedarville and Belcher around 1140 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Toonerville, Mouthcard, Phyllis, Biggs, Fedscreek, Paw Paw, Phelps, Coleman, Jamboree, Argo and Woodman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
